page.title: 04L' Berkhamsted War Memorial.
page.content: As in villages all over the country , this was erected by the parishioners in 1918,in memory of the villagers who lost their lives in the{Great War. The stone cross is set on a triangular grass base,in the centre of the village,at the junction of Church Road and Little Berkhamsted Lane.The memorial is maintained voluntarily by Mr.Vingo who lives on Church Road. The inscription is{"Faithful unto {Death",}and underneath on three of the six panels are written the nine names of those who lost their lives. In 1945, seven more names were added, and the words "The following made the supreme sacrifice for the cause of freedom and justice" { The Parish Council}is responsible for its care.
